[h1]The Good[/h1][list]
[*] It's the characters, story, and OST from the show and movies. It's why I nominated it in three categories of the Steam Awards even though it feels like it's riding on the coattails of its 2011 success (which is the unfortunate reality of the franchise other than Rebellion).
[*] Gameplay is simple and discovering synergies with a limited pool of characters feels rewarding. You can clear battles well above your "party rank" if you're actually awake.
[*] The 3D models look great and the animations they're rigged to definitely work in their favor.
[/list]
[h1]The Bad[/h1][list]
[*] Voice lines you redeem for the sand currency are not subtitled except if you pick that meguca to be your background and repeatedly click on them. Inconvenient, but not a dealbreaker.
[*] The original content can't really stack up to the original story, and it's apparent. Full stop.
[*] I didn't clock why it has a "streamer mode" until I rolled two characters who are running around in their underwear. They make even the protagonist of Magia Record have a chaste-looking design in comparison.
[*] It takes longer than watching the movie or the TV show. Battles feel like filler after you've fought the exact same mob composition several times over in the same dungeon crawl.
[*] Maybe it's a quirk of the engine, but the Live2D models appear to be marionettes on strings that suddenly jerk into their animation sequence during the VN bits. Just uncanny enough to momentarily jerk you out of the story.
[/list]
[h1]The Ugly[/h1][list]
[*] [b]Kernel level anticheat.[/b] If anything is going to make me install this faster, it's this. Purportedly it uninstalls with the game, but according to the intro, you lose your progress when you uninstall. Are we really getting this serious over jpegs?
[*] When they can't bother to depict it any other way, they seem to use 720p aliased screenshots from the TV release, not the BD or the movies. Assuming this is intended to be played on contemporary monitors, why? Why play this when I can just watch something using the exact same frames in better quality?
[*] I am getting the distinct feeling I'm about to run up against a grind at around 10 hours in and I'd rather spend my time grinding, at worst, in an MMO where I get measurable progress in a persistent world I can share with others. There do appear to be social features, but at that point, why not just discuss meguca online with the millions of people who've already seen it, or make mods for games that aren't as unfriendly to the customer to spread the word of [spoiler]Madokami[/spoiler] to others?

 and make no mistake. this IS a gooner game. its a gooner game for lolicons, specifically. most of the characters are in extremely skimpy outfits, several in thongs and the like. the story dosent matter, if youve watched the anime youve already seen everything its going to show you, so just skip EVERY scene. the auto-battler aspect of the game is worthless trash, it just spams out attacks against random targets with no regards to anything like all garbage tier gacha trash. and OF COURSE it follows the scummy genshin model of buying premium currency for money > using that premium currency to then buy tickets > trading those tickets for pulls with a"puty system" that dosent carry over between loot chests. and you WILL have to spend several hundred dollars to progress eventually, because its not enough to just get the monthly 5 star unit, you HAVE to get that same (or any limited banner character) unit some 10 or so times to power them up enough to actually take on the late game missions.

It's... it's bad folks.

Particularly crippling is the lack of any vsynch option, so expect constant frame-tearing unceasingly as you play. Expect random FPS drops and stutters, because this a mobile port; it's almost certainly running on an emulator trying to pretend its a mobile phone, to then try and run a game with kernel-level anticheat. It's frankly kind of doomed on that front.

The gameplay loop is barely present; you 'explore' dungeons automatically with no player input, and the battles can just be auto'd and ignored. There's basically nothing here. It's a gacha game with gacha game levelling mechanics; you level your units indepedent of the stages you play, so either you steamroll on the first turn or you faceplant a stat-wall. There is no inbetween. There never is with these games.

Inbetween the battles you often get little VN segments... but so far all these have been is Live2D sprites in a very different artstyle intercut with stills taken directly from the anime series. It's... jarring. No attempt has been made to try and rework the anime's scenes to better fit VN presentation, in fact I'm quite sure they're actually re-using the anime's voice-acting. This game is a goddamn awful way to experience the original series, so you haven't seen it, just... watch it. Don't play this game to do it instead. They would have been better off including the original episodes wholesale, or using the game's 3D models instead of the Live2D sprites (it would have kept the artstyle more consistent at least). There's so many bad decisions in this game.

As for its original story, it's... eeeeh. It's largely just a framing device for an amnesiac protagonist to rewatch the original show. It tries to set up an air of mystery, but we're never going to get answers anyway. Not before the servers inevitably shut down.

Every previous online Madoka game inevitably got shuttered. MagiReco was far more successful, and even that got shuttered to make way for this game. This game is not going to last. Don't waste your time and money.
